snippet: Data from the Institute for Supply Management showed signs of a weakening economy, but service companies are still hiring, as are factories.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports its index of nonmanufacturing activity fell to 52.1 in June, from a May reading of 53.7; reading above 50 indicates expansion, and sector has grown for 30 straight months; Labor Department reports weekly unemployment benefit applications fell by 14,000 to a seasonally adjusted 374,000.
lead_paragraph: Data from the Institute for Supply Management showed signs of a weakening economy, but service companies are still hiring, as are factories.

headline.seo: Service Sector Grows at Slowest Pace in Two Years
headline.main: Service Sector Increases at Slowest Pace in 2 Years
headline.print_headline: Service Sector Increases At Slowest Pace in 2 Years
